content.description: Although this climb has two pitches, the second pitch gets the three star rating.  Very nice crack climb.
content.protection: Standard rack to 3 inches.  There are two bomber rap anchors at the top of this climb.
content.location:
Located on the left side of the formation.  Purchase the Marty Karabin pocket guide for specifics. 

  A moderate up-hill bushwhack is required to get to the base of the rock.  We found a good descent path (climbers right- follow the gully) back to the road, however, which made the return trip pleasant.

content.description:
Sunny and generally south to south-east facing.  This can be considered a secluded (remote) area.  Of course, the road noise can, at times, be distracting. 

  The approach to the wall requires a steep hike up hill, bushwhacking through cacti and agave. 

  Rock quality is good to very good.
